creator: apachebugs@tgabber.mine.nu
text:
in an .htaccess file I am using the directive

ErrorHeader set Cache-Control "no-cache"

in an attempt to prevent caching of 302 redirect responses (and all other 
errors)

However the header is getting added to ALL responses including code 200

I tried overriding it with a following

Header unset Cache-Control

but this has no effect

or

Header set Cache-Control "public"

which adds a second Cache-Control header to 200 reponses but still leaves the 
no-cache header.

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
It looks to me like this is a documentation error.  What ErrorHeader does
is set r->err_headers_out.  But, a bit misleadingly, this implies that
the header goes on both the normal and error responses.

Although my knowledge in this area is limitted, I don't believe there is any
easy way (either in the configuration or in the code) to specify that a header
will be sent only on error responses.

So my recommendation is to change this to a doc bug.  But I'll leave it
for someone a bit more familiar with this stuff to verify.
